articles.title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
articles.author: George Orwell
articles.content: It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen. Winston Smith, his chin nuzzled into his breast in an effort to escape the vile wind, slipped quickly through the glas doors of Victory Mansion, though not quickly enough to prevent a swirl of gritty dust from entering aling with him.
